title: The Esperance story
creator_credit: Michael Thornhill, Richard Mason, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Western Australia. Dept. of Native Welfare
brief_description: Esperance, a small town on the southern coast of Western Australia, is a community centre for wealthy pastoralists and graziers. A smaller number of First Nations people also live thereunder the control of the Western Australian Department of Native Welfare. The establishment of some First Nations farming businesses is an economic opportunity but also a challenge to the town’s culture.
